body:
Hello @Stephanessy, thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) to get started, and see our [Google Colab Notebook](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb), [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3), and [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) for example environments. 
  
If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you.
@Stephanessy its self explanatory. it's looking for ../coco/train2017.txt, and it doesn't exist.
@Stephanessy this path is relative to the file calling the command. i.e. if you cd into yolov3/ it is searching for ../coco/train2017.txt.
@glenn-jocher If my path is ~yolo/yolov3-master...... Where should I run the command "python /path/to/train.py" so that it can find ../coco/train2017.txt?
coco should be next to yolov3 folder
anyone can provide train2017.txt and val2017.txt for coco dataset. thanks.

So the database.py is located in utils in root folder - it is calling the correct Dir, since utils/.. is root and utils/../coco/ is the folder coco in the root folder. If you run the command in the rootfolder, thius error should not pop up - yet it does.

File is there. File has right ownership and CHMOD. Error still occouring. Whats going on? :(
So a solution is to modify the file data/coco2017.data and remove the ../s there -> it works afterwards just fine.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

@elesun2018: I have found them train2017.txt and val2017.txt here:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hhk7734/tensorflow-yolov4/master/test/dataset/train2017.txt
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hhk7734/tensorflow-yolov4/master/test/dataset/val2017.txt

(Note: I am still checking to make sure if they are the required files as I get Assertion Error when I try to run ScaledYOLOv4 test.py on an image: "No images found in ../coco/val2017.txt")
